result.execSummary:
The defendant Candance Lynn Mountain was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Heidi J. Mangelsen   DF:  Candance Lynn Mountain appeared. Case called at 3:35. Includes 15CM196, 15CM359. ADA Nieskes updates the court, there is an agreement. Atty. Mangelsen agrees.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads    to 15CM196. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of 15CM196. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses 15CM359 with prejudice. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. Crt orders:
- 3 days St. Croix County Jail. Credit for time served
- Costs
  Apply bond on file.
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
- Restitution of $22.31   

DE to meet with the payment clerk.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: Heidi J. Mangelsen DF: Candance Lynn Mountain appeared. Case called at 2:39. Includes 15CM359, 15CM196. ADA Nieskes updates the court and believes they are headed towards resolution. Atty. Mangelsen agrees. There is a question about restitution. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  Heidi J. Mangelsen, DF:  Candance Lynn Mountain appeared.   Includes 15CM359 & 15CM196.  Court confirms address.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG on 15CM196.  Waives speedy trial.   State to provide discovery within 20 days and motions within 10 days upon receipt of discovery. Court orders face to face settlement conference before next hearing.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Bond on file.

Includes 15CM196 & 15CM359

Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Wal-Mart New Richmond.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
From L. Nelson to parties. Re: appointment of counsel. km
Atty Mangelsen

There has been no offer extended. DE may possibly have new charges.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

DE called to request to change her Atty.  DE stated she had already written a letter requesting this, but hasn't heard back from the court.  DE was advised that the last letter we rec'd was on 4-20-15, but that there was no sort of request to change her Atty.  DE was given her Atty's number and was advised to contact him & to leave a msg if he does not answer as court appearance is scheduled for 6-01-15. jaf

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty Caton. km
Candance Mountain  15R 005182. eif

Bail/bond hearing on April 10, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on June 1, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Wal-Mart New Richmond WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton,  DF:  Candance Lynn Mountain appeared from jail. Court confirms address. Defendant is on a PO hold.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 01:00 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
